definition: to spit/fig. to spit out (a request, an agreement etc)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: In Kenya the Massai people usually greet each other by spitting on his or her body.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚马塞族人用往对方身上吐口水的方式打招呼。

sentences.english: I spit at the vacant heavens.
The spitting here we are talking is totally different from what we see every day.
sentences.chinese: 这里的吐口水跟我们日常所见的意义完全是两回事。

sentences.english: He spit on his hands and rubbed them together.
sentences.chinese: 往手掌上吐口吐沫，双手搓了几下。

sentences.english: Spitting is disgusting at all times.
sentences.chinese: 无论什么时候，吐口水都是恶心的行为。

sentences.english: You enter information and the program spits out your list.
sentences.chinese: 走进你的资料和节目吐口水列清单。

sentences.english: He grew hair long, wore colourful clothes and spat at an umpire.
sentences.chinese: 他留长发，穿花衣服，朝裁判吐口水。

sentences.english: Why do students upstairs to downstairs spit male teachers?
sentences.chinese: 为什么学生会从楼上向楼下男教师吐口水？

sentences.english: You will get fined if you spit on the street.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在街上乱吐口水，你会被罚钱。

sentences.english: Watch out when you spit —you might hit someone behind you.
sentences.chinese: 当你吐口水的时候注意了，别吐到你后面的人都身上。

definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to take one's revenge/to score off sb
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
